newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia immigration says alert after HK handover.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia immigration says alert after HK handover.

text.p: Authorities will increase their alertness against possible attempts by Hong Kong people to immigrate to Indonesia after the colony's handover to China next week, the official Antara news agency reported on Saturday.
Hong Kong reverts to China from British rule at midnight on June 30.
Antara quoted Director-General of Immigration Pranowo as saying on Friday Hong Kong people might seek to enter Indonesia under the pretext of family reunions or doing business.

He said immigration officials would tighten procedures on issue of visas. "We will tighten checks against visa applications in coordination with other offices concerned," Pranowo was quoted as saying.
Hong Kong authorities assured Jakarta in March that travel documents would remain valid after the handover, making it unnecessary to send home some 60,000 Hong Kong people now working in Indonesia.
They hold Hong Kong Certificates of Identity, a travel document held by about 1.3 million permanent residents of the territory who have no claim to a national passport of any country.
